solution:
We can factor a constant out of the first radical:  \begin{align*}
\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}} &= \sqrt{4+\sqrt{4(2+c)}}\\
&= \sqrt{4+2\sqrt{2+c}}\\
&= \sqrt{2(2+\sqrt{2+c})}\\
&= \sqrt{2}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}}.
\end{align*}Then, we can combine like terms and solve: \begin{align*}
\sqrt{2}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} &= 2+2\sqrt{2}\\
\Rightarrow \qquad (1+\sqrt{2})\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} &=2(1+\sqrt{2})\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} &= 2\\
\Rightarrow \qquad 2+\sqrt{2+c} &= 4\\
\Rightarrow \qquad \sqrt{2+c} &= 2\\
\Rightarrow \qquad 2+c &= 4\\
\Rightarrow \qquad c &= \boxed{2}
\end{align*}
model_solution:
## Step 1: Move all terms involving square roots to the left-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} - 2 - 2\sqrt{2} = 0$

## Step 2: Move the constant terms to the right-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 2 + 2\sqrt{2}$
## Step 3: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the outermost square roots
$\left( \sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} \right)^2 = \left( 2 + 2\sqrt{2} \right)^2$

$4+\sqrt{8+4c}+2+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$
## Step 4: Expand the square roots and combine like terms
$6+\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$
## Step 5: Move all terms not involving the product of square roots to the right-hand side
$2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}}=8\sqrt{2}-6-\sqrt{8+4c}-\sqrt{2+c}$
## Step 6: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$4\left(4+\sqrt{8+4c}\right)\left(2+\sqrt{2+c}\right)=64\cdot 2 - 288 - 16\sqrt{8+4c} - 16\sqrt{2+c} - 2\left(8+4c\right)\left(\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}\right)$
## Step 7: Expand and simplify the equation
$32+8\sqrt{8+4c}+16\sqrt{2+c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 128-288-16\sqrt{8+4c}-16\sqrt{2+c}-16\sqrt{8+4c}-8\sqrt{2+c}-8c\sqrt{8+4c}-8c\sqrt{2+c}$
## Step 8: Simplify the equation
$160-16\sqrt{8+4c}-16\sqrt{2+c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c}+8\sqrt{8+4c}+16\sqrt{2+c} = 0$
## Step 9: Combine like terms and simplify the equation
$160+8\sqrt{8+4c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 0$
## Step 10: Move all terms not involving the square roots to the right-hand side and simplify
$4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c}+8\sqrt{8+4c}=-160$

$4\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-160$

$\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-40$
## Step 11: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$\left( \sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right) \right)^2 = (-40)^2$
steps:
## Step 1: Move all terms involving square roots to the left-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} - 2 - 2\sqrt{2} = 0$

## Step 2: Move the constant terms to the right-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 2 + 2\sqrt{2}$

## Step 3: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the outermost square roots
$\left( \sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} \right)^2 = \left( 2 + 2\sqrt{2} \right)^2$

$4+\sqrt{8+4c}+2+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$

## Step 4: Expand the square roots and combine like terms
$6+\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$

## Step 5: Move all terms not involving the product of square roots to the right-hand side
$2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}}=8\sqrt{2}-6-\sqrt{8+4c}-\sqrt{2+c}$

## Step 6: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$4\left(4+\sqrt{8+4c}\right)\left(2+\sqrt{2+c}\right)=64\cdot 2 - 288 - 16\sqrt{8+4c} - 16\sqrt{2+c} - 2\left(8+4c\right)\left(\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}\right)$

## Step 7: Expand and simplify the equation
$32+8\sqrt{8+4c}+16\sqrt{2+c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 128-288-16\sqrt{8+4c}-16\sqrt{2+c}-16\sqrt{8+4c}-8\sqrt{2+c}-8c\sqrt{8+4c}-8c\sqrt{2+c}$

## Step 9: Combine like terms and simplify the equation
$160+8\sqrt{8+4c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 0$

## Step 10: Move all terms not involving the square roots to the right-hand side and simplify
$4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c}+8\sqrt{8+4c}=-160$

$4\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-160$

$\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-40$

## Step 11: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$\left( \sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right) \right)^2 = (-40)^2$
full_steps:
## Step 1: Move all terms involving square roots to the left-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} - 2 - 2\sqrt{2} = 0$

## Step 2: Move the constant terms to the right-hand side
$\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 2 + 2\sqrt{2}$

## Step 3: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the outermost square roots
$\left( \sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}+ \sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} \right)^2 = \left( 2 + 2\sqrt{2} \right)^2$

$4+\sqrt{8+4c}+2+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$

## Step 4: Expand the square roots and combine like terms
$6+\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}+2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}} = 8+8\sqrt{2}$

## Step 5: Move all terms not involving the product of square roots to the right-hand side
$2\sqrt{4+\sqrt{8+4c}}\sqrt{2+\sqrt{2+c}}=8\sqrt{2}-6-\sqrt{8+4c}-\sqrt{2+c}$

## Step 6: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$4\left(4+\sqrt{8+4c}\right)\left(2+\sqrt{2+c}\right)=64\cdot 2 - 288 - 16\sqrt{8+4c} - 16\sqrt{2+c} - 2\left(8+4c\right)\left(\sqrt{8+4c}+\sqrt{2+c}\right)$

## Step 7: Expand and simplify the equation
$32+8\sqrt{8+4c}+16\sqrt{2+c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 128-288-16\sqrt{8+4c}-16\sqrt{2+c}-16\sqrt{8+4c}-8\sqrt{2+c}-8c\sqrt{8+4c}-8c\sqrt{2+c}$

## Step 9: Combine like terms and simplify the equation
$160+8\sqrt{8+4c}+4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c} = 0$

## Step 10: Move all terms not involving the square roots to the right-hand side and simplify
$4\sqrt{8+4c}\sqrt{2+c}+8\sqrt{8+4c}=-160$

$4\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-160$

$\sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right)=-40$

## Step 11: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the product of square roots
$\left( \sqrt{8+4c}\left(\sqrt{2+c}+2\right) \right)^2 = (-40)^2$
